title: Properties of the canonical representation of a rational

blocks.name: cnumer
blocks.content: Extend class notation to include canonical numerator function.

diff.cnumer.c
diff.cnumer.w

blocks.content: Extend class notation to include canonical denominator function.

blocks.name: diff.cdenom.s
diff.cdenom.c

df-numer
blocks.content: The canonical numerator of a rational is the numerator of the rational's reduced fraction representation (no common factors, denominator positive). (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 13-Sep-2014.)

blocks.name: df-denom
blocks.content: The canonical denominator of a rational is the denominator of the rational's reduced fraction representation (no common factors, denominator positive). (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 13-Sep-2014.)

thm zsqrtelqelz(class c0) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧(sqrt ` c0)∈ ℚ)→(sqrt ` c0)∈ ℤ)
} = {
  mpbid((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧(sqrt ` c0)∈ ℚ), (sqrt ` c0)∈ ℤ, (denom `(sqrt ` c0))= 1)
  sq11d((denom `(sqrt ` c0)), nat1, (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧(sqrt ` c0)∈ ℚ))
  nnred((denom `(sqrt ` c0)), (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧(sqrt ` c0)∈ ℚ))
  1red((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧(sqrt ` c0)∈ ℚ))
  nn0ge0d((denom `(sqrt ` c0)), (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧(sqrt ` c0)∈ ℚ))
  nnnn0d((denom `(sqrt ` c0)), (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧(sqrt ` c0)∈ ℚ))
  adantl(c0 ∈ ℤ, (sqrt ` c0)∈ ℚ, (denom `(sqrt ` c0))∈ ℕ)
  qdencl((sqrt ` c0))
  a1i((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧(sqrt ` c0)∈ ℚ), 0[≤]1)
  0le1()
  3eqtr2rd(((denom `(sqrt ` c0))[^]2), (1[^]2), nat1, (denom `((sqrt ` c0)[^]2)), (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧(sqrt ` c0)∈ ℚ))
  a1i((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧(sqrt ` c0)∈ ℚ), (1[^]2)= 1)
  sq1()
  eqtrd((denom `((sqrt ` c0)[^]2)), nat1, (denom ` c0), (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧(sqrt ` c0)∈ ℚ))
  fveq2d(cdenom, ((sqrt ` c0)[^]2), c0, (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧(sqrt ` c0)∈ ℚ))
  adantr(c0 ∈ ℤ, (sqrt ` c0)∈ ℚ, ((sqrt ` c0)[^]2)= c0)
  sqsqrtd(c0, c0 ∈ ℤ)
  zcn(c0)
  mpbird((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧(sqrt ` c0)∈ ℚ), (denom ` c0)= 1, c0 ∈ ℤ)
  simpl(c0 ∈ ℤ, (sqrt ` c0)∈ ℚ)
  syl((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧(sqrt ` c0)∈ ℚ), ((denom ` c0)= 1 ↔ c0 ∈ ℤ), c0 ∈ ℚ)
  adantr(c0 ∈ ℤ, (sqrt ` c0)∈ ℚ, c0 ∈ ℚ)
  zq(c0)

  adantl(c0 ∈ ℤ, (sqrt ` c0)∈ ℚ, (denom `((sqrt ` c0)[^]2))=((denom `(sqrt ` c0))[^]2))
  densq((sqrt ` c0))
  adantl(c0 ∈ ℤ, (sqrt ` c0)∈ ℚ, ((denom `(sqrt ` c0))= 1 ↔(sqrt ` c0)∈ ℤ))
  qden1elz((sqrt ` c0))
}

blocks.name: nonsq
blocks.content: Any integer strictly between two adjacent squares has an irrational square root. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 15-Sep-2014.)
